member.name: T:Serenity.Web.ImageScaleMode
member.summary: Thumbnail scaling modes

member.name: F:Serenity.Web.ImageScaleMode.StretchToFit
member.summary: In this mode, thumbnail is generated just at the size requested. If thumbnail width or height specified only, than thumbnail will have same aspect ratio, otherwise if thumbnail and source is not at same ratio, thumbnail will have a narrowed or widened look.

member.name: F:Serenity.Web.ImageScaleMode.PreserveRatioNoFill
member.summary: Try to keep original aspect ratio of source image while generating the thumbnail. If only width or height is set, it works same way with StretchToFit. When both set, thumbnail width or height will be decreased suitably.

member.name: F:Serenity.Web.ImageScaleMode.PreserveRatioWithFill
member.summary: It is logically same with PreserveRatioNoFill but this time instead of decreasing thumbnail width or height, empty parts are filled.

member.name: F:Serenity.Web.ImageScaleMode.CropSourceImage
member.summary: In this mode only central part of source image (horizontally or vertically) is taken to keep thumbnail at requested size if aspect ratio of source image is different.

member.summary: Generates a seed for Random object.

member.summary: Generates a 64 bit random generation number (version key)

member.name: M:Serenity.TwoLevelCacheExtensions.Get``1(Serenity.Abstractions.ITwoLevelCache,System.String,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan,System.String,System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Tries to read a value from local cache. If it is not found there, tries the distributed cache. If neither contains the specified key, produces value by calling a loader function and adds the value to local and distributed cache for a given expiration time. By using a group key, all items on both cache types that are members of this group can be expired at once.
member.remarks: To not check group generation every time an item is requested, generation number itself is also cached in local cache. Thus, when a generation number changes, local cached items might expire after about 5 seconds. This means that, if you use this strategy in a web farm setup, when a change occurs in one server, other servers might continue to use old local cached data for 5 seconds more. If this is a problem for your configuration, use DistributedCache directly.
member.param: The item key for local and distributed cache
Distributed cache expiration (is usually same with local expiration)

Group key that will hold generation (version). Can be used to expire all items that depend on it. This can be a table name. When a table changes, you change its version, and all cached data that depends on that table is expired.
The delegate that will be called to generate value, if not found in local cache, or distributed cache, or all found items are expired.

member.name: M:Serenity.TwoLevelCacheExtensions.Get``1(Serenity.Abstractions.ITwoLevelCache,System.String,System.TimeSpan,System.String,System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Tries to read a value from local cache. If it is not found there, tries the distributed cache. If neither contains the specified key, produces value by calling a loader function and adds the value to local and distributed cache for a given expiration time. By using a group key, all items on both cache types that are members of this group can be expired at once.
member.remarks: To not check group generation every time an item is requested, generation number itself is also cached in local cache. Thus, when a generation number changes, local cached items might expire after about 5 seconds. This means that, if you use this strategy in a web farm setup, when a change occurs in one server, other servers might continue to use old local cached data for 5 seconds more. If this is a problem for your configuration, use DistributedCache directly.
member.param: The item key for local and distributed cache

Group key that will hold generation (version). Can be used to expire all items that depend on it. This can be a table name. When a table changes, you change its version, and all cached data that depends on that table is expired.
The delegate that will be called to generate value, if not found in local cache, or distributed cache, or all found items are expired.

member.name: M:Serenity.TwoLevelCacheExtensions.GetLocalStoreOnly``1(Serenity.Abstractions.ITwoLevelCache,System.String,System.TimeSpan,System.String,System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Tries to read a value from local cache. If it is not found there produces value by calling a loader function and adds the value to local cache for a given expiration time. By using a generation (item version) key, all items on local cache that are members of this group can be expired at once.
member.remarks: The difference between this and Get method is that this one only caches items in local cache, but uses distributed cache for versioning. To not check group generation every time an item is requested, generation number itself is also cached in local cache. Thus, when a generation number changes, local cached items might expire after about 5 seconds. This means that, if you use this strategy in a web farm setup, when a change occurs in one server, other servers might continue to use old local cached data for 5 seconds more. If this is a problem for your configuration, use DistributedCache directly.
member.param: The item key for local and distributed cache

Group key that will hold generation (version). Can be used to expire all items that depend on it. This can be a table name. When a table changes, you change its version, and all cached data that depends on that table is expired.
The delegate that will be called to generate value, if not found in local cache, or distributed cache, or all found items are expired.

member.summary: Changes a group generation value, so that all items that depend on it are expired.

member.summary: Removes a key from local, distributed caches, and removes their generation version information.

member.name: T:Serenity.ComponentModel.DisplayFormatAttribute
member.summary:
Sets the display format for a column. This has no effect on editors! It is only for Display, "NOT Editing". For editing, you have to change UI culture.
Display format strings are specific to column data and formatter type.
If column is a Date or DateTime column, its default formatter accepts custom DateTime format strings like "dd/MM/yyyy". We don't suggest setting DisplayFormat for dates explicitly, use UI culture setting in Web.config unless a column has to display date/time in a different order than the default. You may also use following standard format strings:
- "d": "dd/MM/yyyy" where DMY order changes based on current UI culture.
- "g": "dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm" where DMY order changes based on current UI culture.
- "G": "dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm:ss" where DMY order changes based on current UI culture.
- "s": "yyydd-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss" ISO sortable date time format.
- "u": "yyydd-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.fffZ" ISO 8601 UTC.
If column is an integer, double or decimal it accepts.NET custom numeric format strings like "#,##0.00", "0.#"

member.summary: Placed on rows / or custom lookup classes to denote it has a lookup script. When placed on a row class, lookup scripts only transfer ID and Name fields by default to client side for security / performance reasons. Make sure you add [LookupInclude] attribute to properties you'll need to access from script.

member.name: M:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupScriptAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a LookupScriptAttribute with auto determined lookup key

member.name: M:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupScriptAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a LookupScriptAttribute.

member.name: M:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupScriptAttribute.AutoLookupKeyFor(System.Type)
member.summary: When lookup key is null, e.g. default constructor is used, this method tries to determine the lookup key by looking at the type this attribute is placed on. This is a combination of module identifier and type name. If type has a [Module] attribute it is used, otherwise module identifier is determined from namespace, by removing ".Entities", ".Scripts", ".Lookups" common suffixes and the root namespace (e.g. the first part of namespace before the first dot). Type name is determined from class type name, with common suffixes like "Row" or "Lookup" removed.
member.param: Type to generate a lookup key for

member.name: M:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupScriptAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Defines that this type has an external lookup script type, and the lookup key is available on that type. Use this overload only for row types that have external lookups.
member.param: Script type with LookupScript attribute of its own.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupScriptAttribute.Key
member.summary: Lookup key, usually in "Module.EntityName" format.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupScriptAttribute.Permission
member.summary: Permission key required to access this lookup script. Use special value "?" for all logged-in users. Use special value "*" for anyone including not logged-in users.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupScriptAttribute.Expiration
member.summary: Cache duration in seconds

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupScriptAttribute.LookupType
member.summary: External lookup script type or base type that should be used for generating dynamic lookup script. Only meaningful for Row types with external lookup scripts. Can be a generic type of TRow or a simple lookup class.

member.summary: If you use this constructor, service will tried to be determined by module and name of the row class, and idField and textField will be determined by rows id and name fields.

member.name: M:Serenity.ComponentModel.ServiceLookupEditorAttribute.AutoServiceFor(System.Type)
member.summary: When service is null, this method tries to determine the service by looking at the type this attribute is placed on. This is a combination of module identifier and type name. If type has a [Module] attribute it is used, otherwise module identifier is determined from namespace, by removing ".Entities", ".Scripts", ".Lookups" common suffixes and the root namespace (e.g. the first part of namespace before the first dot). Type name is determined from class type name, with common suffixes like "Row" or "Lookup" removed.
member.param: Type to generate a service for

member.summary: Allows dynamically creating new options from text input by the user in the search box. This option should only be used for free text inputs, not ID / Text pairs. When this option is enabled InplaceAdd cannot be used. Newly created option will have same ID / Text which is user entered text.

member.summary: Enable inplace add / edit functionality

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.ServiceLookupEditorBaseAttribute.DialogType
member.summary: This property is meaningful when InplaceAdd is true. By default, dialog type name is determined by service, e.g. if service is "Northwind/CustomerCity/List", a dialog class named "Northwind.CustomerCityDialog" is used. If dialog type is different than the service, set this to classname, e.g. "MyModule.MyDialog"

member.summary: Cascade filtering field (items will be filtered on this key, e.g. CountryID)

member.summary: Cascade filtering value, usually set by CascadeFrom editor, e.g. the integer value of CountryID If null or empty, and CascadeField is set, all items are filtered

member.summary: Optional filtering field (items will be filtered on this key, e.g. GroupID)

member.summary: Optional filtering value, e.g. the integer value of GroupID. If null or empty string no filtering occurs.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.ServiceLookupEditorBaseAttribute.MinimumResultsForSearch
member.summary: The minimum number of results that must be initially (after opening the dropdown for the first time) populated in order to keep the search field. This is useful for cases where local data is used with just a few results, in which case the search box is not very useful and wastes screen space. The option can be set to a negative value to permanently hide the search field.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this attribute should apply to following properties until next occurence of this attribute without JustThis flag.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.LabelWidthAttribute.JustThis
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this attribute shouldn't break effectiveness of another LabelWidth attribute with UntilNext flag. For example, if you set all fields to 100px by adding a [LabelWidth("100px", UntilNext = true)] attribute to the first property of a form, but just want to change one property in the middle to 200px, and if you add [LabelWidth("200px")] to that property, 100px would not apply to following ones. But if you did [LabelWidth("200px", JustThis = true)], 100px will still apply to following ones.
member.value: true if it should break effectiveness of a prior LabelWidth attribute with UntilNext flag, otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the hint. This is only used for forms and it is shown when the label is hovered.

member.summary: Gets or sets the initial collapsed status of the category this property is in.

member.summary: Gets or sets the read only flag of the property in forms.

member.summary: Gets or sets the read permission. If user doesn't have this permission, they won't see it in grid / form.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.PropertyItem.Insertable
member.summary: Gets or sets the insertable flag of the property. If this is false, the property won't be serialized back in new record forms. Does not apply to grids.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.PropertyItem.InsertPermission
member.summary: Gets or sets the insert permission. If user doesn't have this permission, field won't be serialized back in new record forms and it will be readonly.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.PropertyItem.HideOnInsert
member.summary: Gets or sets the hide on insert flag which controls visibility of the property in new record forms.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.PropertyItem.Updatable
member.summary: Gets or sets the updatable flag of the property. If it is false, property won't be serialized back in edit forms and it will be readonly.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.PropertyItem.UpdatePermission
member.summary: Gets or sets the update permission. If user doesn't have this permission, field won't be serialized back in edit record forms and it will be readonly.

member.summary: Gets or sets the hide on update flag which controls visibility of the property in edit record forms.

member.summary: Gets or sets the one way flag, which when true field won't be serialized back to entity on save.

member.name: M:Serenity.ComponentModel.DefaultFilenameFormatSanitizer.SanitizePlaceholder(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Default implementation for sanitizing values of replacement placeholders in a file name format string like |X|/|Y|. Trims the value, if is empty, returns "_". , Characters like '/', '&', and diacricits etc are replaced by calling StringHelper.SanitizeFileName, then replacing backslashes with underscore, double dots and tailing dots with underscore
member.param: Key for placeholder, ignored by this implementation.

member.name: M:Serenity.ComponentModel.DefaultFilenameFormatSanitizer.SanitizeResult(System.String)
member.summary: Sanitizing an upload filename formatting result by replacing backslashes with forward slashes, and replacing double slashes with "/_/".

member.summary: Editor type key

member.name: T:Serenity.ComponentModel.IUploadEditor
member.summary: Runs FileUploadBehavior or MultipleFileUploadBehavior behaviors. Make sure you use this attribute in Row.cs, not Form.cs as the image upload behavior only works if it is in row, otherwise your files will stay in temporary directory.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.IUploadEditor.IsMultiple
member.summary: Sets if the editor is going to be used for multiple file upload.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.IUploadEditor.DisableDefaultBehavior
member.summary: If you don't want FileUploadBehavior / MultipleFileUploadBehavior to process this upload, and want to handle it manually, set to true (not recommended)

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.IUploadEditor.UploadIntent
member.summary: This is a property used to match uploaded files with their origins. If not specified, will be calculated as: "FullTypeName,AssemblyName:PropertyName" from the attribute this property is placed on. This way the temporary upload processor can locate the original attribute by its type name and validate its settings or generate the expected thumbnail types.

member.name: T:Serenity.ComponentModel.IUploadFileConstraints
member.summary: Constraints of the uploaded file size.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.IUploadFileConstraints.AllowNonImage
member.summary: Should non-image uploads be allowed.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.IUploadFileConstraints.AllowedExtensions
member.summary: Semicolon separated list of allowed file extensions, like ".xlsx;.docx;.jpg" etc. If specified, only allow files with these extensions. This is currently only used by the upload behavior, the editor and temporary upload does not yet use this setting.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.IUploadFileConstraints.ExtensionBlacklist
member.summary: Contains extensions that are considered dangerous / disallowed. Default is ".asax;.compiled;.ascx;.asmx;.aspx;.bat;.cmd;.com;.config;.dll;.jar;.jsp;.htaccess;.htpasswd;.lnk;.php;.ps1;.vbe;.vbs"

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.IUploadFileConstraints.ImageExtensions
member.summary: Semicolon separated list of image extensions. The default list is ".gif;.jpg;.jpeg;.png;" If specified, only these set of file extensions are considered as images and thumbnails are only generated for them. This is currently only used at behavior level. The upload editors and temporary upload do not check them yet. Note that if AllowNonImage is false, only these extensions are allowed and only if they contain a valid image.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.IUploadFileConstraints.MaxSize
member.summary: Maximum size in bytes of the uploaded file.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.IUploadFileConstraints.MinSize
member.summary: Minimum size in bytes of the uploaded file.

member.name: T:Serenity.ComponentModel.IUploadFileOptions
member.summary: Upload options related to the file name and encoding

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.IUploadFileOptions.CopyToHistory
member.summary: Should a copy of file placed in a special history folder on upload. This helps preserving old files on update.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.IUploadFileOptions.DisplayFileName
member.summary: If you have no original name property but use original name in file name with {4} format parameter, set this to true to force the upload editor to show file name.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.IUploadFileOptions.FilenameFormat
member.summary: Format of the file name like "ProductImage/{1:00000}/{0:00000000}_{2}". Parameter 0 is the row identity value, 1 is identity value / 1000, and 2 is a random string like 2cxs4bc, 3 is current date/time, 4 is original file name. You can also use the shortcut "ProductImage/~" which is equivalent to the prior sample. If you don't specify this, it will default to something like Product/ProductImage/~ which is generated by combining row class name and field name.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.IUploadFileOptions.JsonEncodeValue
member.summary: Only useful for uploading multiple files. Specifies whether to JSON encode value. If your field is a string field set it to true.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.IUploadFileOptions.OriginalNameProperty
member.summary: If you want to store original name of the file uploaded, set this to the name of another string field. Only used for single image uploads.

member.name: T:Serenity.ComponentModel.IUploadImageContrains
member.summary: Contstraints for the uploaded image.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.IUploadImageContrains.IgnoreExtensionMismatch
member.summary: If set to false, the upload behavior raises an error when it detects the extension does not match the actual format of the uploaded file. For example, if the uploaded file is "test.jpg" but it has a "png" image inside it raises an error. Default is true, so such mismatches are ignored

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.IUploadImageContrains.IgnoreEmptyImage
member.summary: If the file contains an empty image, ignore it instead of raising an error.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.IUploadImageContrains.IgnoreInvalidImage
member.summary: If the file contains an invalid image, ignore it instead of raising an error.

summary.p: Returns true if is null or empty (zero length)

member.returns: If is null or empty, true

member.name: M:Serenity.StringHelper.IsNullOrEmpty(System.String)

summary.p: Returns true if is null or empty (zero length)

This is an extension method, so it can be called directly as str.IsNullOrEmpty().

member.returns: If is null or empty, true

member.name: M:Serenity.StringHelper.IsTrimmedEmpty(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if a string is null, empty or just contains whitespace characters.

remarks.p: Warning: "\n" (line end), "\t" (tab) and some other are also considered as whitespace). To see a list see function.
This is an extension method, so it can be called directly as str.IsTrimmedEmpty().

member.returns: If string is null, empty or contains only white space, true

member.name: M:Serenity.StringHelper.TrimToNull(System.String)

summary.p: Removes whitespace characters in the left or right of the string, and if resulting string is empty or null, returns null.

remarks.p: Generally, when a user entered string is going to be saved to database, if user entered an empty string, null or a string of whitespaces, it is stored as null, otherwise it is expected to remove whitespace at start and end only.
Warning: "\n" (line end), "\t" (tab) and some other are also considered as whitespace). To see a list see function.
This is an extension method, so it can be called directly as str.TrimToNull().

member.returns: Trimmed string, result is null if empty.

summary.p: Removes whitespace characters in the left or right of the string, and if resulting string is empty or null, returns empty.

remarks.p: Generally, when a user entered string is going to be saved to database, if user entered an empty string, null or a string of whitespaces, it is stored as empty string, otherwise it is expected to remove whitespace at start and end only.
Warning: "\n" (line end), "\t" (tab) and some other are also considered as whitespace). To see a list see function.
This is an extension method, so it can be called directly as str.TrimToEmpty().

member.name: M:Serenity.StringHelper.IsTrimmedSame(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compares two strings ignoring whitespace at the left or right.

remarks.p: null is considered to be empty.
Warning: "\n" (line end), "\t" (tab) and some other are also considered as whitespace). To see a list see function.
This function can be used to compare a string entered by user to the value in the database for equality.

member.returns: If two strings are same trimmed, true

member.name: M:Serenity.StringHelper.ThreeDots(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: If the string's length is over a specified limit, trims its right and adds three points ("...").
member.remarks: This is an extension method, so it can be called directly as str.ThreeDots().
member.param: Maximum length for the resulting string. If given as 0, or is shorter than this value, string returns as is. Otherwise it is trimmed to be under this limit in length including "the three dots".
member.returns: itself, or trimmed and three dotted string

member.summary: Clears a folder based on default conditions
member.remarks: If any errors occur during cleanup, this doesn't raise an exception and ignored. Other errors might raise an exception. As errors are ignored, method can't guarantee that less than specified number of files will be in the folder after it ends.

member.name: M:Serenity.IO.TemporaryFileHelper.PurgeDirectory(System.String,System.TimeSpan,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Clears a folder based on specified conditions
member.param: Files with creation time older than this is deleted. If passed as 0, time based cleanup is skipped.
If more than this number of files exists, files will be deleted starting from oldest to newest. By passing 0, all files can be deleted. If passed as -1, file count based cleanup is skipped.
Safety file to be checked. If it is specified and it doesn't exists, operation is aborted.
member.remarks: If any errors occur during cleanup, this doesn't raise an exception and ignored. Other errors might raise an exception. As errors are ignored, method can't guarantee that less than specified number of files will be in the folder after it ends.

member.name: T:Serenity.Localization.LocalTextRegistry
member.summary: Default ILocalTextRegistry implementation.
member.remarks: This implementation also supports a "pending approval" mode. If your site needs some moderator approval before translations are published, you may put your site to this mode when some moderator is using the site by registering an ILocalTextContext provider. Thus, moderators can see unapproved texts while they are logged in to the site.

member.name: M:Serenity.Localization.LocalTextRegistry.Add(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a local text entry to the registry

member.name: M:Serenity.Localization.LocalTextRegistry.AddPending(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a pending approval local text entry to the registry. These texts can only be seen while moderators are browsing the site. You can determine which users are moderators by implementing ILocalTextContext interface, and registering it through the service locator.

member.name: M:Serenity.Localization.LocalTextRegistry.TryGet(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts the local text key to its representation in requested language. Looks up text in requested language, its Fallbacks and invariant language in order. If not found in any, null is returned. See SetLanguageFallback for information about language fallbacks.
member.param: If pending approval texts to be used, true.

member.name: M:Serenity.Localization.LocalTextRegistry.SetLanguageFallback(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the language fallback of the specified language. When a text is not found in one language, LocalTextRegistry checks its language fallback for a translation. Some implicit language fallback definitions exist even if none set. For example, "en" is language fallback ID of "en-US" and "en-UK", "tr" is language fallback ID of "tr-TR". Also, invariant language ID ("") is an implicit fallback of all languages.

member.name: M:Serenity.Localization.LocalTextRegistry.GetAllAvailableTextsInLanguage(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets all available text keys (that has a translation in language or any of its language fallbacks) and their local texts.
member.param: True if pending texts should be returned (e.g. in preview/edit mode).
member.returns: A dictionary of all texts in the language.

member.summary: Gets all text keys that is currently registered in any language

member.name: M:Serenity.Localization.LocalTextRegistry.RemoveAll
member.summary: Removes all cached texts

member.name: T:Serenity.Localization.NestedLocalTextRegistration
member.summary: Contains helper methods for registration of local texts in nested static classes. Nested static contains LocalText objects with actual translations as keys. This class locates them (with NestedLocalTextsAttribute at outermost class), determines keys by path from outermost to nested class name, replaces existing LocalText instance with a InitializedLocalText instance containing this generated key and initial translation, and registers this translation in ILocalTextRegistry provider.

member.name: M:Serenity.Localization.NestedLocalTextRegistration.AddNestedTexts(Serenity.Abstractions.ILocalTextRegistry,Serenity.Abstractions.ITypeSource)
member.summary: Adds translations from static nested local text classes marked with NestedLocalTextAttribute.

member.name: T:Serenity.Localization.NestedPermissionKeyRegistration
member.summary: Contains helper methods for registration of permission keys in nested static classes. These classes contains string constants containing permission keys. Display name for permission keys can be set by [DisplayName] attribute. Display name for groups can be set by [Description] attribute on classes themselves. For group display name to work, all constants in a class must start with same group prefix.

member.name: M:Serenity.Localization.NestedPermissionKeyRegistration.AddNestedPermissions(Serenity.Abstractions.ILocalTextRegistry,Serenity.Abstractions.ITypeSource)
member.summary: Gets permission keys and adds texts if any from static nested permission key classes marked with NestedPermissionKeys attribute.
